labels.analysis: The ClickUp MCP Server specializes in integrating with ClickUp's project management platform, allowing users to interact with tasks, lists, and folders through AI-powered natural language commands. Its core functionality revolves around task and project management, featuring tools for creating, updating, moving, duplicating, and deleting both individual and bulk tasks. Additionally, it provides tools for managing lists and folders within a ClickUp workspace. The primary problem it solves is streamlining project management workflows by enabling efficient task handling and automation.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is "Daily Productivity" since the server's core purpose is to enhance productivity by managing tasks and projects within ClickUp. "Project Management" is added as a custom label because it specifically targets project workflow automation. "API Integration" is included as a secondary label because the server facilitates interaction with ClickUp's API for these operations.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: ClickUp MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @windalfin/clickup-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Integrate ClickUp tasks with AI applications to streamline your project management. Interact with tasks, lists, and folders using natural language for efficient task handling. Enhance your productivity by automating workflows and managing tasks seamlessly within your ClickUp workspace.

tools.name: get_workspace_hierarchy
tools.description: Deploy Server ClickUp MCP Server @windalfin/clickup-mcp-server Try in Playground get_workspace_hierarchy

tools.name: create_task
tools.description: Create a single task in a ClickUp list. Use this tool for individual task creation only. For multiple tasks, use create_bulk_tasks instead. Before calling this tool, check if you already have the necessary list ID from previous responses in the conversation history, as this avoids redundant lookups. When creating a task, you must provide either a listId or listName.

tools.name: get_task
tools.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific task. Valid parameter combinations: 1. Use taskId alone (preferred) 2. Use taskName + optional listName (to disambiguate if multiple tasks have the same name)

tools.name: get_tasks
tools.description: Retrieve tasks from a list with optional filtering. You MUST provide either: 1. listId (preferred) 2. listName Use filters to narrow down results by status, dates, etc.

tools.name: update_task
tools.description: Modify an existing task's properties. Valid parameter combinations: 1. Use taskId alone (preferred if you have it) 2. Use taskName + optional listName (to disambiguate if multiple tasks have the same name) At least one update field (name, description, status, priority) must be provided. Only specified fields will be updated.

tools.name: move_task
tools.description: Move a task to a different list. Valid parameter combinations: 1. Use taskId + (listId or listName) - preferred 2. Use taskName + sourceListName + (listId or listName) WARNING: Task statuses may reset if destination list has different status options.

tools.name: duplicate_task
tools.description: Create a copy of a task in the same or different list. Valid parameter combinations: 1. Use taskId + optional (listId or listName) - preferred 2. Use taskName + sourceListName + optional (listId or listName) The duplicate preserves the original task's properties.

tools.name: delete_task
tools.description: ⚠️ PERMANENTLY DELETE a task. This action cannot be undone. Valid parameter combinations: 1. Use taskId alone (preferred and safest) 2. Use taskName + optional listName (use with caution)

tools.name: create_bulk_tasks
tools.description:
Create multiple tasks in a list efficiently. You MUST provide:
1. An array of tasks with required properties
2. Either listId or listName to specify the target list

Optional: Configure batch size and concurrency for performance.

tools.name: update_bulk_tasks
tools.description: Update multiple tasks efficiently. For each task, you MUST provide either: 1. taskId alone (preferred) 2. taskName + listName Only specified fields will be updated for each task.

tools.name: move_bulk_tasks
tools.description: Move multiple tasks to a different list efficiently. For each task, you MUST provide either: 1. taskId alone (preferred) 2. taskName + listName WARNING: Task statuses may reset if target list has different status options.

tools.name: delete_bulk_tasks
tools.description: ⚠️ PERMANENTLY DELETE multiple tasks. This action cannot be undone. For each task, you MUST provide either: 1. taskId alone (preferred and safest) 2. taskName + listName (use with caution)

tools.name: create_list
tools.description: Create a new list directly in a ClickUp space (not in a folder). You MUST provide either spaceId or spaceName. For creating lists inside folders, use create_list_in_folder instead.

tools.name: create_list_in_folder
tools.description: Create a new list within a ClickUp folder. You MUST provide either: 1) folderId alone, or 2) folderName WITH either spaceName or spaceId. Folder names may not be unique across spaces, which is why space information is required when using folderName.

tools.name: get_list
tools.description: Retrieve details about a specific ClickUp list. You MUST provide either listId or listName. Using listId is more reliable as list names might not be unique.

tools.name: update_list
tools.description: Update an existing ClickUp list's properties. You MUST provide either listId or listName, and at least one field to update (name, content, or status).

tools.name: delete_list
tools.description: Permanently delete a ClickUp list and all its tasks. You MUST provide either listId or listName. WARNING: This action cannot be undone.

tools.name: create_folder
tools.description: Create a new folder in a ClickUp space for organizing related lists. You MUST provide: 1. A folder name 2. Either spaceId (preferred) or spaceName After creating a folder, you can add lists to it using create_list_in_folder.

tools.name: get_folder
tools.description: Retrieve details about a specific folder including name, status, and metadata. Valid parameter combinations: 1. Use folderId alone (preferred) 2. Use folderName + (spaceId or spaceName) Helps you understand folder structure before creating or updating lists.

tools.name: update_folder
tools.description: Modify an existing folder's properties. Valid parameter combinations: 1. Use folderId alone (preferred) 2. Use folderName + (spaceId or spaceName) At least one update field (name or override_statuses) must be provided.

tools.name: delete_folder
tools.description: ⚠️ PERMANENTLY DELETE a folder and all its contents. This action cannot be undone. Valid parameter combinations: 1. Use folderId alone (preferred and safest) 2. Use folderName + (spaceId or spaceName) WARNING: This will also delete all lists and tasks within the folder.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@windalfin/clickup-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
